# Add Trusted Teaching Content

When you're training people on regulated subjects ‚Äî food safety, compliance, medical protocols ‚Äî the AI **must** teach from authoritative sources. Trust levels control how strictly the AI uses your content.

## What you'll learn

- **Upload documents** ‚Äî PDFs, DOCX, TXT files
- **Assign trust levels** ‚Äî L0 (Unverified) through L5 (Verified Fact)
- **See assertion extraction** ‚Äî how the system pulls out teaching points
- **Track freshness** ‚Äî when content expires and needs updating

## Why this matters

For regulated training, incorrect content isn't just unhelpful ‚Äî it can be dangerous. Trust levels are your guardrail.

## Time: ~5 minutes

Use **‚Üê ‚Üí** arrow keys or the buttons below to navigate.

steps.title: Trust Level Selection
steps.description: Assign a trust level to the uploaded content. This controls how strictly the AI uses the material ‚Äî from casual reference to verbatim quoting.

right.body:
## Trust Levels Explained

| Level | Name | How the AI Uses It |
|-------|------|--------------------|
| **L0** | Unverified | Background context only |
| **L1** | Community | Can discuss freely, note uncertainty |
| **L2** | Editorial | Teach as generally accepted |
| **L3** | Professional | Teach as authoritative |
| **L4** | Certified | Must cite source, high accuracy |
| **L5** | Verified Fact | Must quote exactly, zero deviation |

## When to Use Each Level

- **L0-L1**: Blog posts, forum discussions, general references
- **L2-L3**: Textbooks, professional guides, industry standards
- **L4-L5**: Legal requirements, safety regulations, certified curricula

For regulated training (food safety, compliance), **always use L4 or L5**.

steps.reason: Trust levels are the core safety mechanism. Getting this right means the AI teaches accurately for your specific domain ‚Äî especially critical for regulated subjects.

tips.message: For regulated subjects, use L4+ to ensure the AI teaches with appropriate accuracy and citation

steps.title: Content Freshness
steps.description: Content doesn't last forever ‚Äî regulations change, facts update. The freshness system tracks when content was last verified and alerts you when it needs review.

content.body:
# Content Freshness & Expiry

Teaching material has a shelf life. The system tracks freshness so you're never teaching from stale content.

## How It Works

- **Upload date** ‚Äî when the content was added
- **Last verified** ‚Äî when someone confirmed it's still accurate
- **Expiry date** ‚Äî when it needs re-verification (configurable)
- **Freshness badge** ‚Äî green (fresh), amber (aging), red (expired)

## For Regulated Training

Regulatory content often has specific update cycles:
- Food safety certifications: typically annual
- Compliance documents: varies by jurisdiction
- Safety protocols: review after any incident

Set expiry dates that match your regulatory requirements.

## Summary

You've learned how to:
- Upload curriculum documents
- Assign appropriate trust levels (L0-L5)
- Review extracted assertions
- Link content to subjects
- Track content freshness
